src.hashers package

Submodules

src.hashers.division_method_hasher module

Adds the remainder of a modulus to a 64 bit hash, for each byte in the input.

class src.hashers.division_method_hasher.DivisionMethodHasher[source]

Bases: Hasher

Concrete implementation of the Abstract Hasher class that takes the modulus of each byte k by M and adds the remainder to a 64 bit hash.

hash(raw_bytes: bytes) → Hash[source]

Calculates the hash by taking the modulus of each byte and adding it to a 64-bit hash.

Args:

raw_bytes (bytes): Array of bytes of the input.

Returns:

The hash of the input bytes.

src.hashers.folding_method_hasher module

Folding hash implementation, breaks up key value into segments that are added to form a hash value

Bases: Hasher

Returns:

The hash of the input bytes.

src.hashers.multiplication_method_hasher module

Multiplication Hash which follows the formula h(K) = floor (M (kA mod 1)).

class src.hashers.multiplication_method_hasher.MultiplicationHasher[source]

Bases: Hasher

  1. Choose a constant value A such that 0 < A < 1.

  2. Multiply the key value with A.

  3. Extract the fractional part of kA.

  4. Multiply the result of the above step by the size of the hash table i.e. M.

  5. The resulting hash value is obtained by taking the floor of the result obtained in step 4.

credits: https://cs.kenyon.edu/index.php/scmp-218-00-data-structures/types-of-hash-functions/

hash(raw_bytes: bytes) → Hash[source]

Calculates the hash by a concrete method for each byte and adding it to an N-bit hash.

Args:

raw_bytes (bytes): Array of bytes of the input.

Returns:

The hash of the input bytes.

rotl32(x, n)[source]

src.hashers.pearson_hasher module

Pearson Hashing Algorithm

class src.hashers.pearson_hasher.PearsonHasher[source]

Bases: Hasher

Pearson hashing is a non-cryptographic hash function designed for fast execution on processors with 8-bit registers. Given an input consisting of any number of bytes, it produces as output a single byte that is strongly dependent on every byte of the input.

credit: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Pearson_hashing

hash(raw_bytes: bytes) → Hash[source]

The Pearson hashing method is designed for 8-bit processes and is a non-crypto method of producing a message digest. It produces an 8-bit value which is dependent on the data produce. It uses a 256-byte lookup table, and then iterate around the bytes in the data.

Arg:

raw_bytes (bytes): Array of bytes of the input.

Returns:

The hash result of the input bytes after running Pearson Hash

=======

src.hashers.sha1_hasher module

SHA-1 cryptographic hash algorithm that is meant to keep data secured, using bitwise operations, modular additions, and compression functions.

class src.hashers.sha1_hasher.SHA1Hasher[source]
